Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel; white slip; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting perhaps of lion's mane with added red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Since its publication in Lemos and Fairbanks, the sherd has been broken and not been restored. While the fringe of a lion's mane is typically represented in a triangular pattern with added red, it is unusal to see a double triangular pattern as displayed on this sherd.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 322, no. 1452, pl. 192)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 103, pl. XXXII, no. 310.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2200) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
